openrpc.description: This string MUST be the [semantic version number](https://semver.org/spec/v2.0.0.html) of the [OpenRPC Specification version](#versions) that the OpenRPC document uses. The `openrpc` field SHOULD be used by tooling specifications and clients to interpret the OpenRPC document. This is *not* related to the API [`info.version`](#info-version) string.
openrpc.title: openrpc

servers.description: An array of Server Objects, which provide connectivity information to a target server. If the `servers` property is not provided, or is an empty array, the default value would be a [Server Object](#server-object) with a [url](#server-url) value of `localhost`.
servers.title: servers

methods.title: methods
methods.description: The available methods for the API. While it is required, the array may be empty (to handle security filtering, for example).

components.title: components
components.description: Holds a set of reusable objects for different aspects of the OpenRPC. All objects defined within the components object will have no effect on the API unless they are explicitly referenced from properties outside the components object.

schemas.title: schemaComponents
schemas.description: An object to hold reusable [Schema Objects](#schema-object).

links.title: linkComponents
links.description: An object to hold reusable [Link Objects](#link-object).

errors.title: errorComponents
errors.description: An object to hold reusable [Error Objects](#error-object).

examples.title: exampleComponents
examples.description: An object to hold reusable [Example Objects](#example-object).

examplePairings.title: examplePairingComponents
examplePairings.description: An object to hold reusable [Example Pairing Objects](#example-pairing-object).

contentDescriptors.title: contentDescriptorComponents
contentDescriptors.description: An object to hold reusable [Content Descriptor Objects](#content-descriptor-object).

tags.title: tagComponents
tags.description: An object to hold reusable [Tag Objects](#tag-object).

$schema.title: metaSchema
$schema.description: JSON Schema URI (used by some editors)

specificationExtension.title: specificationExtension
specificationExtension.description: This object MAY be extended with [Specification Extensions](#specification-extensions).

code.title: errorObjectCode
code.description: A Number that indicates the error type that occurred. This MUST be an integer. The error codes from and including -32768 to -32000 are reserved for pre-defined errors. These pre-defined errors SHOULD be assumed to be returned from any JSON-RPC api.

message.title: errorObjectMessage
message.description: A String providing a short description of the error. The message SHOULD be limited to a concise single sentence.

data.title: errorObjectData
data.description: A Primitive or Structured value that contains additional information about the error. This may be omitted. The value of this member is defined by the Server (e.g. detailed error information, nested errors etc.).

licenseObject.title: licenseObject
licenseObject.description: License information for the exposed API.

name.title: licenseObjectName
name.description: The license name used for the API.

url.title: licenseObjectUrl
url.description: A URL to the license used for the API. MUST be in the format of a URL.

contactObject.description: Contact information for the exposed API.
contactObject.title: contactObject

name.title: contactObjectName
name.description: The identifying name of the contact person/organization.

email.title: contactObjectEmail
email.description: The email address of the contact person/organization. MUST be in the format of an email address.

url.title: contactObjectUrl
url.description: The URL pointing to the contact information. MUST be in the format of a URL.

infoObject.title: infoObject
infoObject.description: The object provides metadata about the API. The metadata MAY be used by the clients if needed, and MAY be presented in editing or documentation generation tools for convenience.

description.title: infoObjectDescription
description.description: A verbose description of the application. [GitHub Flavored Markdown syntax](https://github.github.com/gfm/) MAY be used for rich text representation.

termsOfService.title: infoObjectTermsOfService
termsOfService.description: A URL to the Terms of Service for the API. MUST be in the format of a URL.

version.title: infoObjectVersion
version.description: The version of the OpenRPC document (which is distinct from the [OpenRPC Specification version](#openrpc-document-openrpc) or the API implementation version).

url.title: serverObjectUrl
url.description: A URL to the target host. This URL supports Server Variables and MAY be relative, to indicate that the host location is relative to the location where the OpenRPC document is being served. [Server Variables](#server-variables) are passed into the [Runtime Expression](#runtime-expression) to produce a server URL.

name.title: serverObjectName
name.description: An optional string describing the name of the server. [GitHub Flavored Markdown syntax](https://github.github.com/gfm/) MAY be used for rich text representation.

description.title: serverObjectDescription
description.description: An optional string describing the host designated by the URL. [GitHub Flavored Markdown syntax](https://github.github.com/gfm/) MAY be used for rich text representation.

summary.title: serverObjectSummary
summary.description: A short summary of what the server is.

variables.title: serverObjectVariables
variables.description: A map between a variable name and its value. The value is passed into the [Runtime Expression](#runtime-expression) to produce a server URL.

[0-z]+.title: serverObjectVariable
[0-z]+.description: An object representing a Server Variable for server URL template substitution.

default.title: serverObjectVariableDefault
default.description: The default value to use for substitution, which SHALL be sent if an alternate value is _not_ supplied. Note this behavior is different than the [Schema Object's](#schema-object) treatment of default values, because in those cases parameter values are optional.

description.title: serverObjectVariableDescription
description.description: An optional description for the server variable. [GitHub Flavored Markdown syntax](https://github.github.com/gfm/) MAY be used for rich text representation.

enum.title: serverObjectVariableEnum
enum.description: An enumeration of string values to be used if the substitution options are from a limited set.

items.title: serverObjectVariableEnumItem
items.description: An enumeration of string values to be used if the substitution options are from a limited set.

method.title: linkObjectMethod
method.description: The name of an existing, resolvable OpenRPC method, as defined with a unique `method`. This field MUST resolve to a unique [Method Object](#method-object). As opposed to Open Api, Relative `method` values ARE NOT permitted.

description.title: linkObjectDescription
description.description: A description of the link. [GitHub Flavored Markdown syntax](https://github.github.com/gfm/) MAY be used for rich text representation.

params.title: linkObjectParams
params.description: A map representing parameters to pass to a method as specified with `method`. The key is the parameter name to be used, whereas the value can be a constant or a [runtime expression](#runtime-expression) to be evaluated and passed to the linked method.

server.title: linkObjectServer
server.description: A server object to be used by the target method.

description.description: A verbose explanation of the documentation. [GitHub Flavored Markdown syntax](https://github.github.com/gfm/) MAY be used for rich text representation.
description.title: externalDocumentationObjectDescription

url.description: The URL for the target documentation. Value MUST be in the format of a URL.
url.title: externalDocumentationObjectUrl

methodObject.title: methodObject
methodObject.description: Describes the interface for the given method name. The method name is used as the `method` field of the JSON-RPC body. It therefore MUST be unique.

name.title: methodObjectName
name.description: The cannonical name for the method. The name MUST be unique within the methods array.

description.title: methodObjectDescription
description.description: A verbose explanation of the method behavior. GitHub Flavored Markdown syntax MAY be used for rich text representation.

summary.title: methodObjectSummary
summary.description: A short summary of what the method does.

servers.title: servers
servers.description: An array of Server Objects, which provide connectivity information to a target server. If the `servers` property is not provided, or is an empty array, the default value would be a [Server Object](#server-object) with a [url](#server-url) value of `localhost`.

tags.title: methodObjectTags
tags.description: A list of tags for API documentation control. Tags can be used for logical grouping of methods by resources or any other qualifier.

paramStructure.title: methodObjectParamStructure
paramStructure.description: Format the server expects the params. Defaults to 'either'.

params.title: methodObjectParams
params.description: A list of parameters that are applicable for this method. The list MUST NOT include duplicated parameters and therefore require [name](#content-descriptor-name) to be unique. The list can use the [Reference Object](#reference-object) to link to parameters that are defined by the [Content Descriptor Object](#content-descriptor-object). All optional params (content descriptor objects with "required": false) MUST be positioned after all required params in the list.

result.title: methodObjectResult
result.description: The description of the result returned by the method. If defined, it MUST be a Content Descriptor or Reference Object. If undefined, the method MUST only be used as a [notification](https://www.jsonrpc.org/specification#notification)

errors.title: methodObjectErrors
errors.description: A list of custom application defined errors that MAY be returned. The Errors MUST have unique error codes.

links.title: methodObjectLinks
links.description: A list of possible links from this method call.

examples.title: methodObjectExamples
examples.description: Array of [Example Pairing Objects](#example-pairing-object) where each example includes a valid params-to-result [Content Descriptor](#content-descriptor-object) pairing.

deprecated.title: methodObjectDeprecated
deprecated.description: Declares this method to be deprecated. Consumers SHOULD refrain from usage of the declared method. Default value is `false`.

tagObject.title: tagObject
tagObject.description: Adds metadata to a single tag that is used by the [Method Object](#method-object). It is not mandatory to have a Tag Object per tag defined in the Method Object instances.

description.title: tagObjectDescription
description.description: A verbose explanation for the tag. [GitHub Flavored Markdown syntax](https://github.github.com/gfm/) MAY be used for rich text representation.

externalDocs.description: Additional external documentation for this tag.

exampleObject.title: exampleObject
exampleObject.description: The Example object is an object that defines an example that is intended to match the `schema` of a given [Content Descriptor](#content-descriptor-object).

value.title: exampleObjectValue
value.description: Embedded literal example. The `value` field and `externalValue` field are mutually exclusive. To represent examples of media types that cannot naturally represented in JSON, use a string value to contain the example, escaping where necessary.

description.title: exampleObjectDescription
description.description: A verbose explanation of the example. [GitHub Flavored Markdown syntax](https://github.github.com/gfm/) MAY be used for rich text representation.

examplePairingObject.title: examplePairingObject
examplePairingObject.description: The Example Pairing object consists of a set of example params and result. The result is what you can expect from the JSON-RPC service given the exact params.

description.title: examplePairingObjectDescription
description.description: A verbose explanation of the example pairing.

result.title: examplePairingObjectResult
result.description: Example result. When not provided, the example pairing represents usage of the method as a notification.

contentDescriptorObject.title: contentDescriptorObject
contentDescriptorObject.description: Content Descriptors are objects that do just as they suggest - describe content. They are reusable ways of describing either parameters or result. They MUST have a schema.

name.title: contentDescriptorObjectName
name.description: Name of the content that is being described. If the content described is a method parameter assignable [`by-name`](#method-param-structure), this field SHALL define the parameter's key (ie name).

description.title: contentDescriptorObjectDescription
description.description: A verbose explanation of the content descriptor behavior. [GitHub Flavored Markdown syntax](https://github.github.com/gfm/) MAY be used for rich text representation.

summary.title: contentDescriptorObjectSummary
summary.description: A short summary of the content that is being described.

required.title: contentDescriptorObjectRequired
required.description: Determines if the content is a required field. Default value is `false`.

deprecated.title: contentDescriptorObjectDeprecated
deprecated.description: Specifies that the content is deprecated and SHOULD be transitioned out of usage. Default value is `false`.
